snippet: Typhoon Melor roared through the storm-scarred central islands of the country on Tuesday, leaving floods, debris and widespread blackouts in its wake.
abstract: Philippines claims to evacuate over 724,839 people ahead of Typhoon Melor; reports regional destruction but no casualties, though restoration of communication could reveal fatalities; officials mandated stricter evacuation policies after Typhoon Haiyan killed 7,000 people in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Typhoon Melor roared through the storm-scarred central islands of the country on Tuesday, leaving floods, debris and widespread blackouts in its wake.

headline.main: Mass Evacuations Conducted as Typhoon Hits Philippines
headline.print_headline: Mass Evacuations Conducted as Typhoon Hits Philippines
